required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention of Breast Cancer-related Lymphedma With Tacrolimus
clinical_study.official_title: Prevention of Breast Cancer-related Lymphedma With Tacrolimus

brief_summary.textblock: Breast cancer-related lymphedema is one of the most common and feared consequences of breast cancer treatment. Tacrolimus ointment may prevent lymphedema by inhibition of CD4+T cells.

primary_outcome.description: Arm size change >= 10% using water displacement

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective changes assessed using the LYMPH-ICF (Lymphoedema Functioning, Disability and Health) questionaire
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective change of lymphedema assessed by questionnaire. Range: 0-100. 100 being the most bothered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective changes assessed using DASH (DISABILITIES OF THE ARM, SHOULDER AND HAND) questionaire
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective change of lymphedema assessed by questionnaire. Range: 1-5. 5 being the most bothered

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective changes assessed using SF-36 questionnaire (Short form-36)
secondary_outcome.description: Subjective change of lymphedema assessed by questionnaire. Range: 0-100. 0 being the most bothered

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in L-DEX score using bioimpedance (Odense University Hospital Only).
secondary_outcome.description: Change in L-DEX score of lymphedema arm derived from bioimpedance. Higher values mean more fluid in the lymphedema arm compared to the healthy arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in lymph drainage. (Odense University Hospital Only).
secondary_outcome.description: Change in lymph drainage assessed by indocyanine-green lymphangiography

arm_group.description: Apply whole arm, in a thin layer, once daily for one year

intervention.description: Treatment with tacrolimus ointment once daily for one year following axillary lymph node dissection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female
- Breast cancer with planned ALND
- postmenopausal or use of contraceptives
- good general health condition
- read and understand Danish
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant, breastfeeding it wishing to conceive with the next year
- bilateral breast cancer
- known allergy to tacrolimus or macrolides
- known lymphedema
- other malignant disease apart from keratinocyte cancer
- in medical treatment for diabetes mellitus
- known psychiatric condition which may influence participation
- known renal or hepatic function

facility.name: Department of Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery

patient_data.ipd_description: all IPD that underlie results in a publication
